title.narrative: Creating Hope in Conflict: A Humanitarian Grand Challenge

description.narrative: Our goal is to find and accelerate life-saving or life-improving innovations to help the most vulnerable and hardest-to-reach people impacted by humanitarian crises caused by conflict. Creating Hope in Conflict: A Humanitarian Grand Challenge, is a partnership of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), the U.K. Department for International Development (DFID), the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands, with support from Grand Challenges Canada.

participating-org.narrative: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

activity-date.narrative: The first request for proposals was issued in February 2018.

recipient-country.narrative: Funds are managed by Grand Challenges Canada and flow down to sub-awardees who are implementing innovation projects. These innovations will involve a connection to the private sector and input from affected communities in order to provide, supply, or locally generate safe drinking water and sanitation, energy, life-saving information, or health supplies and services to help conflict-affected people.

sector.narrative: The innovations supported by HGC cover four broad focus areas: 1) WASH; 2) Life-saving Information; 3) Energy; 4) Health Supplies and Services.
